data

Class DoubleFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.DoubleFunctions

  • public final class DoubleFunctions
extends Object
    Static methods for creating, manipulating, and operating on arrays of primitive doubles.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double[] append(double[] original, double value)
      Append the given value to the end of the original array, and return the result in a new array.
      static double[] arrayFrom(double... data)
      Create and return a new array from the given data.
      static double[] arrayFrom(Double[] data)
      Create a new primitive double array from the given boxed Double array.
      static double[] arrayFrom(List<Double> data)
      Create a new primitive double array from the given list of data.
      static double[] boxCox(double[] data, double lambda)
      Transform the given data using a Box-Cox transformation with the given lambda value.
      static double[] combine(double[]... arrays)
      Create a new array by combining the elements of the input arrays in the order given.
      static double[] fill(int size, double value)
      Create and return a new array of the given size with every value set to the given value.
      static double[] inverseBoxCox(double[] data, double lambda)
      Invert the Box-Cox transformation, returning the original untransformed data.
      static List<Double> listFrom(double... data) 
      static double[] round(double[] values, int precision) 
      static double round(double value, int precision) 
      static double[] slice(double[] data, int from, int to)
      Return a slice of the data between the given indices.
      static double[] sqrt(double... data)
      Take the square root of each element of the given array and return the result in a new array.

      • append

                              double value)
        Append the given value to the end of the original array, and return the result in a new array.
        Parameters:
        original - the array to be appended.
        value - the value to append to the end of the array.
        Returns:
        a new array consisting of the original array with the given value appended to the end.

                            double value)
        Create and return a new array of the given size with every value set to the given value.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of elements of the new array.
        value - the value to fill every element of the array with.
        Returns:
        a new array of the given size with every value set to the given value.

                             int from,
                             int to)
        Return a slice of the data between the given indices.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to slice.
        from - the starting index.
        to - the ending index. The value at this index is excluded from the result.
        Returns:
        a slice of the data between the given indices.

        public static double[] boxCox(double[] data,
                              double lambda)
        Transform the given data using a Box-Cox transformation with the given lambda value.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to transform.
        lambda - the Box-Cox parameter.
        Returns:
        the data transformed using a Box-Cox transformation with the given lambda value.

      • inverseBoxCox

        public static double[] inverseBoxCox(double[] data,
                                     double lambda)
        Invert the Box-Cox transformation, returning the original untransformed data.
        Parameters:
        data - the transformed data to invert.
        lambda - the Box-Cox parameter used in the transformation.
        Returns:
        the original, untransformed data in a new array.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new array containing the square root of each element.
